---
title: "Download dada2"
---

## Binaries

Binaries are available through [Bioconductor](https://www.bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/dada2.html).

```S
## try http:// if https:// URLs are not supported
source("https://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R")
biocLite("dada2")
```

See the [Bioconductor install instructions](https://www.bioconductor.org/install/) if issues arise. In particular, to get the newest release of dada2 through Bioconductor you will need to have the current version of R installed.

## Source

* Current Release [(1.6)](https://github.com/benjjneb/dada2/releases): [Zipped](https://github.com/benjjneb/dada2/archive/v1.6.zip) or [tarball](https://github.com/benjjneb/dada2/archive/v1.6.tar.gz).

* Development Branch [(1.7)](https://github.com/benjjneb/dada2): [Zipped](https://github.com/benjjneb/dada2/archive/master.zip) or [tarball](https://github.com/benjjneb/dada2/archive/master.tar.gz).

* Previous Release [(1.4)](https://github.com/benjjneb/dada2/releases): [Zipped](https://github.com/benjjneb/dada2/archive/v1.4.1.zip) or [tarball](https://github.com/benjjneb/dada2/archive/v1.4.1.tar.gz).
